Accounting Software Redevelopment: Comprehensive Product Development Report

is a widely adopted accounting and business management solution for small and medium enterprises (SMEs), particularly in India and neighboring regions. Its feature set spans invoicing, inventory management, party (customer/vendor) management, payments, GST compliance, backup/restore, and more, delivered via Android, Windows, and web platforms. This report analyzes

current capabilities, UI/UX patterns, inferred data models, and technical architecture, and provides a detailed roadmap for redevelopment into a modern, scalable, and user-friendly SaaS product. Recommendations are grounded in best practices for multi-tenant SaaS, security, compliance, and integration with contemporary payment and messaging platforms.

invoicing module is central to its value proposition. Users can generate professional, GST-compliant invoices in seconds, choosing from multiple templates and customizing with branding elements such as logos and color schemes
. Invoices can be shared instantly via WhatsApp, email, or printed, supporting both retail and B2B workflows. The system supports various invoice types, including standard,
, e-invoice, credit/debit notes, and recurring invoices. Automated calculations for taxes (CGST, SGST,
), discounts, and totals are built-in, with support for HSN/SAC codes and e-way bill numbers for compliance.
Quick invoice creation from sales or purchase modules.
Customizable fields for business and customer details.
Itemized product/service listing with quantity, unit price, and tax breakdown.
Payment terms, due dates, and accepted payment modes (cash, UPI, card, etc.).
Automated reminders for overdue invoices via WhatsApp/SMS.
Invoice preview and theme selection for professional output.
Integration with barcode scanning for rapid item entry
inventory management is robust, supporting real-time stock tracking, batch and expiry management, multi-location warehouses, and barcode integration

. Each sale, purchase, or return transaction auto-adjusts stock levels, minimizing manual errors. Users can generate and print barcode labels, scan items for billing or stock updates, and receive low-stock alerts for timely reordering.
Batch-wise tracking for expiry-sensitive items (pharma, FMCG).
Stock adjustment entries for damaged, expired, or missing items.
Inventory reports: stock summary, valuation, movement trends, item-wise profit/loss.
Customizable inventory settings: categories, units, minimum stock levels.
Integration with accounting for seamless profit/loss and cash flow reporting.
encompasses customer and vendor records, transaction history, outstanding balances, and communication tools
. Users can group parties, assign GSTINs, shipping addresses, and additional fields, and track all interactions for personalized service.
Centralized contact book with emails, phone numbers, preferences.
Transaction logs: purchases, returns, payments, dues per party.
Automated payment reminders and invoice sharing via WhatsApp/SMS.
Credit limit and due date management for risk control.
Party-wise profit/loss and aging reports for receivables management.
Invite parties to self-register via online store integration.
streamlines payment tracking, supporting multiple modes (cash,
, UPI, QR, NEFT, IMPS, e-wallet, card)

. Payment entries are linked to invoices, enabling accurate reconciliation and real-time cash flow visibility. The bank reconciliation module auto-imports bank statements, matches transactions, and flags discrepancies for review.
Payment-in and payment-out entries for sales and purchases.
Bulk reconciliation with smart suggestions and exception management.
Bank account integration for automatic transaction fetching.
Audit trails for all payment activities.
QR code generation for instant UPI payments on invoices.
Reconciliation reports: matched, unmatched, and historical sessions.
1.5 GST Compliance, E-Invoicing, and Tax Reports
is designed for Indian GST compliance, generating e-invoices validated by the Invoice Registration Portal (IRP), embedding IRN and QR codes, and supporting all major GST reports (GSTR-1, 2, 3B, 9)
. Tax calculations are automated, with support for reverse charge, composite scheme, and additional
GSTIN management for parties and transactions.
E-invoice generation and validation via GST APIs.
Real-time reporting and reconciliation with GST portal.
Export of reports in JSON format for filing.
Input Tax Credit (ITC) tracking and vendor-wise reconciliation.
1.6 Backup, Restore, Sync, and Offline-First Behavior
emphasizes data safety with auto-backup to Google Drive, manual backup to device/email, and rapid restore capabilities
. The app operates offline-first, syncing data across devices when connectivity is restored,
Multi-device sync for mobile and desktop.
Data verification utilities to ensure integrity.
Restore workflows for device migration or recovery.
provides a comprehensive dashboard and downloadable reports for sales, expenses, inventory, profit/loss, cash flow, and balance sheet
. Reports are customizable by party, item, category, and period, supporting monthly, quarterly, and annual analysis.
Export to Excel, PDF, and integration with Tally.
Customizable financial statements (P&L, balance sheet, cash flow).
interface employs a left-side navigation drawer on desktop and a bottom tab bar on mobile, following established UX patterns for admin and mobile apps
. The dashboard is the default landing page, presenting key metrics (cash-in-hand, stock value, bank balance) for immediate situational awareness.
Logical menu structure matching accounting workflows (Sale, Purchase, Expense, Reports, etc.).
Contextual help and tooltips for complex features.
Responsive design for consistent experience across devices.
Forms for invoices, payments, and inventory entries are streamlined, with auto-filled fields, barcode scanning, and error prevention mechanisms
. Success/fail messages, notifications, and progress bars guide users through multi-step processes.
Input validation for mandatory fields (e.g., GSTIN, amounts).
Date pickers, dropdowns, and toggles for quick selection.
Real-time feedback on stock updates and payment status.
Reports and dashboards use tables, lists, and cards to organize information, with clear headers and filters for quick access
. Breadcrumbs and hierarchical lists aid navigation in multi-level modules (e.g., item categories, party groups).
Tabular views for transactions, inventory, and reports.
Hierarchical menus for settings and utilities.
mobile app is optimized for thumb-centric navigation, with primary actions within reach zones and swipe gestures for status changes
. Voice dictation, photo integration, and haptic feedback enhance usability for diverse users.
High-contrast themes and adjustable font sizes.
Offline operation for remote or low-connectivity environments.
Role-based access and audit trails for secure multi-user scenarios.
Invoice templates, themes, and color schemes are customizable, allowing businesses to reflect their brand identity
. Users can add logos, footers, and personalized notes to invoices and reports.
Custom fields for transactions and parties.
Configurable date formats, decimal places, and currency.
3. Inferred Data Models and Entity Relationships
Based on feature analysis and UI screenshots, the following core entities and relationships are inferred:
, name, SKU, HSN/SAC, category, unit, price, tax, batch, expiry, stock
: One-to-many (each party can have multiple invoices).
The inferred ER model aligns with standard invoice management systems, supporting extensibility for multi-tenancy, audit trails, and integration with external APIs
4. Recommended Technical Architecture and Modern Tech Stack
-based architecture is recommended for scalability, maintainability, and integration flexibility
: Single-page application (SPA) for web, native/hybrid mobile apps, and desktop clients.
: Relational (PostgreSQL) with support for Row-Level Security (RLS) for multi-tenancy.
Stripe, Plaid, NPCI UPI APIs, WhatsApp Business API, GST APIs
in all tables, enforced via RLS in PostgreSQL
: Role-based permissions at entity and function level
: Immutable, tamper-evident logs for all critical actions
: Independent scaling of modules (invoicing, inventory, reporting).
: Real-time metrics and alerting for latency, errors, and resource usage.
